message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient is pregnant, which limits the options for treatment due to the risk of harm to the fetus. Nitrofurantoin is considered safe for use in pregnancy and is an effective treatment for uncomplicated urinary tract infections. Ampicillin and Ceftriaxone are not typically used to treat UTIs, and Doxycycline is contraindicated in pregnancy.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms suggest a urinary tract infection, which is common in pregnant women. Nitrofurantoin is a safe option for pregnant women with UTI. Ampicillin is not effective for UTI, while Ceftriaxone and Doxycycline have potential risks for the fetus.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms and absence of costovertebral angle tenderness suggest that the patient has a lower urinary tract infection. Nitrofurantoin is safe during pregnancy and effective in treating UTIs. Ampicillin and Ceftriaxone are not recommended for UTIs in pregnancy. Doxycycline is contraindicated for use in pregnancy.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Given the patient's pregnancy, safety of the medication is important. Nitrofurantoin is safe to use in pregnancy, making it the best option for treatment. Ampicillin, Ceftriaxone, and Doxycycline are not considered safe options for treating urinary tract infections during pregnancy.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient has symptoms of a urinary tract infection (UTI) and is pregnant, making Nitrofurantoin the safest and most effective option for treatment of UTI in pregnancy. Ampicillin and Ceftriaxone are not effective against the most common bacteria that cause UTIs, and Doxycycline is contraindicated in pregnancy.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The burning upon urination suggests a urinary tract infection (UTI). However, ampicillin, ceftriaxone, and doxycycline are not the best choices for a pregnant patient. Nitrofurantoin is commonly recommended for UTIs in pregnant women as it has minimal risk to the fetus.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient is pregnant and nitrofurantoin is considered the first-line agent for acute uncomplicated cystitis in pregnancy due to its safety profile. Ampicillin, ceftriaxone, and doxycycline are not indicated for the treatment of cystitis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest a urinary tract infection (UTI), which is common during pregnancy. Nitrofurantoin is safe to use during pregnancy and is a first-line treatment for UTIs in pregnant women. The other options may not be safe or effective during pregnancy.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient presents with symptoms of a urinary tract infection, which is common in pregnant women. Nitrofurantoin is safe to use in pregnancy and is an appropriate treatment choice for uncomplicated urinary tract infections. Aminoglycosides like ampicillin and cephalosporins like ceftriaxone are generally avoided in pregnancy because of the risk of ototoxicity to the fetus. Doxycycline is contraindicated in pregnancy because it can cause discoloration of the baby’s teeth.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient is pregnant, and Nitrofurantoin is a safe and effective antibiotic for treating urinary tract infections during pregnancy. Ampicillin, Ceftriaxone, and Doxycycline are not recommended for use in pregnant women. There is no indication of a severe infection or sepsis, so broad-spectrum antibiotics are not needed.
